name: Earth Star
description: Cryptanthus bivittatus, commonly known as Earth Star, is a terrestrial bromeliad native to tropical regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and features low-growing rosettes (10-20 cm wide) with small, dramatic, star-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive pink to red striped patterns. The plant displays a rosette growth habit. Known as "earth stars" for their low-growing, star-shaped rosettes. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant star-shaped rosettes with stunning striped patterns. It's popular among bromeliad enthusiasts for its attractive striped foliage.
careTips: Keep central cup (vase) filled with water
Water soil sparingly - mainly keep cup filled
Remove dead leaves to maintain appearance
